section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Documentation states that it cannot be determined whether the condition was or was not present on admission

content.full_text: Assign 'W' when the medical record documentation indicates that it cannot be clinically determined whether or not the condition was present on admission. (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
content.summary: Use W indicator when provider explicitly states POA status cannot be clinically determined (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
key_concepts: Clinical determination impossibility (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
Provider statement of inability (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
W indicator assignment (Evidence: pg no: 118, L36)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign W when provider states POA cannot be clinically determined (Evidence: pg no: 118, L36)
detailed_rules.explanation: The W indicator is used specifically when medical record documentation explicitly states that clinical determination of POA status is not possible (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
common_applications: Provider explicitly states cannot determine POA

workflow_steps: Step 1: Look for provider statement about POA determination
Step 2: Confirm provider states clinical determination is impossible

code_categories_mentioned: All conditions where POA cannot be clinically determined

coding_scenarios.scenario: Provider states cannot determine if condition was present on admission
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Unable to clinically determine whether patient's condition was present on admission due to clinical circumstances
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify provider statement about inability to determine
Step 2: Confirm this is clinical determination issue

correct_coding.rationale: Provider explicitly stated clinical determination not possible (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should use W when provider states clinical determination impossible

warnings: Only use when provider explicitly states clinical determination impossible (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
best_practices: Look for explicit provider statements about clinical determination (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
common_mistakes: Confusing W with U indicator (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
tips: W requires provider statement, not just unclear documentation (Evidence: pg no: 118, L35-L36)
implementation_notes: Train coders on difference between U and W indicators
clinical_context: Some clinical situations make POA determination impossible
